snippet: Johnson & Johnson, a developer of the drug, has asked the agency to approve Xarelto to treat deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism.
abstract: Johnson & Johnson says the Food and Drug Administration has agreed to give priority status to its review of three new uses for the anticlotting drug Xarelto; company is asking the agency to approve the drug to treat and then prevent return of deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson, a developer of the drug, has asked the agency to approve Xarelto to treat deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism.
